titleStmt.title: Corpus parlamentar português ParlaMint-PT-en, Série I, Legislatura XIII [ParlaMint-en.ana SAMPLE]
Portuguese parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-PT-en, Series I, Term XIII [ParlaMint-en.ana SAMPLE]
Minutas da Assembleia da República Portuguesa, Sessão 3, Número 22
Minutes of the Assembly of the Portuguese Republic, Session 3, Number 22

respStmt.resp: Machine translation to English and linguistic analysis of the translation
Annotating MTed corpora with USAS semantic tags

funder.orgName: Centre of Linguistics of the University of Lisbon

availability.p: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License

bibl.title: Minutes of the Assembleia da República of Portugal

projectDesc.p: ParlaMint is a project that aims to (1) create a multilingual set of comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings uniformly encoded according to the ParlaMint encoding guidelines, covering the period from 2015 to mid-2022; (2) add linguistic annotations to the corpora and machine-translate them to English; (3) make the corpora available through concordancers; and (4) build use cases in Political Sciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs with this prefix point to aligned source elements of the MTed corpus.

div.head: Quinta-feira, 30 de novembro de 2017 I Série — Número 22
XIII LEGISLATURA 3.ª SESSÃO LEGISLATIVA (2017-2018)
div.note: 25th PLENARY SESSION OF 29 NOVEMBER 2017
Chairman: H.E. Mr. Eduardo Luís Barreto Ferro Rodrigues
Secretaries: Ex.mos Sr. Duarte Rogério Matos Ventura Pacheco Sandra Maria Pereira Pontedeira António Carlos Bivar Branco de Penha Monteiro

SUMMARY The President declared the meeting open at 3 p.m. and 6 minutes. The joint debate of the following diplomas took place in the joint debate: draft law No. 661/XIII (3.a) — Create the military emergency unit (PSD), which was discussed in general, and which, the request of the PSD, came down to the National Defence Commission without a vote for 60 days; draft law No. 662/XIII (3.a); draft law No. 662/XIII (3.a) — create a national control unit (DPD), which was discussed in general by the PSD, and that, the PSD requested by the PSD, which was brought down to the National Defence Commission, without a vote for 60 days; draft law No. 663/XIII III (3.a) — draft law No. 663/X III (3.a) — draft law No. 663/X III (3.a.a.a) — draft law No.I Law No. Law No. Law No. 62/X III (OJ No.) — Creates the military emergency unit of emergency unit of emergency unit (the emergency unit), creating of the emergency unit (R unit), creating of the emergency unit (P unit), creating of the emergency unit), created by the emergency unit), created by the emergency unit (PS (PS), created by the emergency unit, which was created in PED unit, which was created, which was discussed in PED), created, which was discussed in PED), created in PDP (PS), created, which was discussed in general unit, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, which was discussed in general, and that was discussed in general, and that it, and that it, and that it, and that it was discussed, and that it was discussed, and that was discussed, and that it, and that it, and that it was discussed, and that it was discussed, and that it was discussed, and that the role; and that They used the floor in the debate of those diplomas, on a different basis, the Members Fernando Negro (PSD), Telmo Correia (CDS-PP), Heloísa Apollo (Os Verdes), João Ramos (PCP), Carlos Matias (BE), André Silva (PAN), José Miguel Medeiros (PS), Luís Leite Ramos (PSD), José Luís Ferreira (Os Verdes), Patrícia Fonseca (CDS-PP), Berta Cabral (PSD), Isabel Alves Moreira (PS), Jorge Machado (PCP), Sandra Cunha (BE), Santinho Pacheco (PS), Vânia Dias da Silva (CDS-PP), Margarida Balsairo Lopes (PSD), João Oliveira (PCP), Hortense Martins (PS), Mauricio Marques (PSD), João Azevedo Castro (PS), Heitor Sousa (BE), Heitor Filipe (P), António PCP (PS), and Nuno Serra (PSD). The following votes were read and approved: No. 430/XIII (3a) — To regret the victims of the road, on the occasion of the World Day in memory of the victims of the Road Victims, presented by the President of the HR, the PS, the PS, the HR, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, the PS, and the PS, the PS, the PS, the N.S.P., the P.P.P., the P.P., the P.P.P., the P.P.C., the P.P.C., the P.P.C., the P.C.C., the P.C.C., the P.C., the P.C., the P.C. and the P.C.C., (b. (b.o.o.o., N.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o. (R.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o.o After the approval of those votes, the House kept a minute of silence. The following votes were also read and voted: No. 434/XIII (3a) — Greetings for the 42nd anniversary of 25 November, submitted by the CDS-PP, which was approved; No. 439/XIII (3a) condemned for renewing the European glyphosate licence, submitted by BE, which was rejected; No. 441/XIII (3a) — Condemning for the approval of the renewal of the glyphosate licence by the European Union, submitted by the Greens, which was rejected. An application submitted by the PS was approved, requesting the Commission for Economics, Innovation and Public Works to be discharged without a 60-day vote of the proposed Law No 101/XIII (3a) — Sets out the rules on compensation actions for infringement of competition law, transposing Directive 2014/104/EU. In general, Bill No. 102/XIII (3a) was approved — It authorizes the Government to decriminalize and to provide for the illegal counter-ordering of unauthorized public execution of commercially edited phonograms and videograms, and the request of the PSD, which has been discharged to the Committee on Constitutional Affairs, Rights, Freedoms and Guarantees and, consequently, has been postponed its vote in the speciality and overall end. In general, draft Law No. 624/XIII (3a) — Other Decree-Law No. 349/98 of 11 November and Law No. 153/2015 of 14 September 2015 of 14 September in the framework of property assessments (PS), 625/XIII (3a) — In order to strengthen the regulation of the assessment of the appropriate nature of financial instruments (PS), 626/XIII (3a) — To strengthen the regulation of the regulation of the codes of conduct codes of credit institutions (PS), 627/XIII (3a) — To strengthen the regulation concerning independent investment consultants for autonomous investment and financial intermediaries (3a) — To strengthen the regulation of financial intermediaries for independent investment investment in financial instruments (PS), 626/X6/XIII/XIII/X (3a) — To strengthen the regulation of the regulation of credit institutions by credit institutions by credit institutions to qualified credit institutions. Draft resolutions No. 898/XIII (2a) — Recommends that the Government safeguard Robinson's cortex industrial heritage (PSD), 1123/XIII (3a) — Recommends that the Government safeguard and enhance the cortical industrial heritage of the Robinson Factory in Portalegre (Os Verdes), 1126/XIII (3a) — Recommends that the Government promote solutions to preserve and safeguard the industrial heritage of the Robinson Factory (PS), 1128/XIII (3a) — Recommends that the Government, together with the Municipal Chamber of Portalegre and the Robinson Foundation, develop a programme for the recovery, safeguarding and preservation of the cultural heritage, in particular the archaeological and industrial heritage of the Robinson Society (PS), 1128/XIII (3a) — Recommendation for the safeguard, evaluation and dynamization of the former Robinson Factory, for the safeguard and preservation of the heritage of the Solomon Islands, 11th century, and its successor Government of the United Kingdom, 11th century, 11th Industrial Government (CDS-III) In a general vote, motion for a resolution No 58/XIII (3a) adopted — Approves the withdrawal of the reservation made by the Portuguese Republic to the Convention on the Privileges and Immunities of the United Nations adopted by the United Nations General Assembly on 13 February 1946. Draft resolution No 1090/XIII (3a) was adopted — Recommends to the Government the creation of conditions for the replacement of agricultural activity in areas affected by fires (PSD). Paragraphs 1 to 14 of the Journal were approved. Two opinions of the Ethics Sub-Commission, the Committee on Constitutional Affairs, Rights, Freedoms and Guarantees were adopted, authorising one PS Member and another PSD to intervene in court proceedings. The entry into the Bureau of Bill No. 675/XIII (3a) and draft resolutions Nos. 1151 and 1152/XIII (3a). The President closed the meeting at 18 a.m. and 36 minutes.
Explanations of vote sent to the Bureau for publication
For the votes of 439 and 441/XIII (3a):
Parliament rejected two votes presented by the NAP and the Green Party on the renewal of the European glyphosate licence.
This matter has already been the subject of wide debate in plenary on two occasions, with most Members expressing a clear view on the subject — the cessation of the use of glyphosate in Portugal.

For this reason, Portugal's vote in the Council which authorised the extension of the licence is not understood. Abstention does not correspond to the guidance of the parliamentary majority already stated.
This is another matter in which Portugal's interests are double, and they are strongly opposed.

In this respect, as in few cases, my position follows the proposals that have already been adopted, even if it does not see the validity or usefulness of these late positions that we are now voting on.
PS's deputy, Ascension Simões.

With regard to vote No 233/XIII (2a) — Condemning by Holodomor — Large hunger of 1932 and 1933 in Ukraine (PSD, CDS-PP and 1 PS Member). [voted at the plenary meeting of 3 March 2017 — DAR I Series No 59 (2017-03-04)]:
I recognize the Great Hunger of 1932 and 1933 in Ukraine, Holodomor, as one of the crimes against humanity that took place in the 20th century.

The narrative around the experience of this period in Ukraine, but also in Kazakhstan and other former Soviet republics, is caught up in episodes of atrocious degradation of the dignity of the human condition caused by the policy of collecting agriculture imposed by Stalinism.

History cannot be rewritten and the course of time cannot go back, but the rehabilitation and preservation of the memory of the facts and their victims is something that is within our reach as an instrument for reconciliation with the memory of the past, the first step towards building a better future — based on strengthening respect for and defense of freedom and human rights — preventing repetitions of past mistakes.

Despite all this, I voted against vote No 233/XIII (2a), of condemnation, presented by the PSD, because the recognition of a historical fact such as the Holodomor requires to be duly substantiated and can only be presented in the form of a draft resolution.
Only the true 'vote fever' in which Parliament has been plunged in recent times can somehow explain the disagreed size in a way.

I voted against, too, because the text and intervention in plenary took a sense contrary to the reconciliation that it is necessary to promote with the past, so as not to prevent this from preventing a future of peace and progress in the relationship between peoples.

I also voted against this because of the national political moment which is apparent from the fact that this PSD initiative is only now taking place when in 2006, on the eve of the celebration of the 75th anniversary of the Holodomor, a petition was submitted to the Assembly of the Republic of which was rapporteur a Member of this Parliamentary Group.
PS deputy Isabel Santos.

Concerning draft resolution No 586/XIII (2a) — The ratification by the Portuguese State of the United Nations International Convention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families (adopted by Resolution No 45/158 of the General Assembly of 18 December 1990) is hereby decided. [voted at the plenary meeting of 03 March 2017 — DAR I Series No 59 (2017-03-04)]:

I voted against draft resolution No 586/XIII (2a), submitted by the CFP, in accordance with the guidance of the Socialist Party Parliamentary Group, because the International Convention of the United Nations Organization on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families (adopted by Resolution 45/158 of the General Assembly of 18 December 1990) is in the process of ratification by the European Union, making redundant individual processes developed by the different Member States.

Nevertheless, I would like to stress from here my agreement and the importance I attach to the adoption of the Convention, especially at a time when Europe is faced with a wave of migrants who must protect in relation to violations of their rights and their families, generated by the increase in xenophobia and racism to which it is seen in many countries of the European Union and when the fight against the networks of trafficking and exploitation of migrants is increasingly demanding, making it necessary, more than ever, to develop and intensify cooperation between countries of origin, transit and destination.
PS deputy Isabel Santos.

With regard to vote No 244/XIII (2a) — Condemnation by the pressures of the leadership of the Podemos and by the systematic campaign of persecution carried out against professionals from different communication bodies in Spain (PSD) (voted at the plenary meeting of 10 March 2017 — DAR I Series No 62 (2017-03-11)):
The fullness of democracy is umbilically linked, among other things, to freedom of expression and opinion.

During my journey, but especially in my capacity as Chairman of the Committee on Democracy, Human Rights and Humanitarian Affairs of the OSCE Parliamentary Assembly, I have repeatedly raised my voice in defence of press freedom in several states party to this organization, where journalists are threatened, persecuted or arrested and the media bodies not aligned with the power in force are the target of the most diverse pressures and closures.
In all these years, I have never seen the PSD come to condemn any of these situations in countries where the rule of law is fragile and daily called into question.

Therefore, I cannot help but look at vote No 244/XIII (2.a) — Condemning by the pressures of the leadership of the Powers and the systematic campaign of persecution carried out against professionals of different communication bodies in Spain, when, in addition to the above mentioned, the PSD had no reaction at all at the time when a family member of a minister of his last government threatened a journalist — in a case that was currently tried in a sentencing court.

These kinds of convictions are always laudable to the violation of fundamental rights, but we must be consistent in our actions and that they are valid for themselves and do not become inconceivable objectives such as what makes this difference in conduct, i.e. mere political belligerence, trying to create another space of confrontation with the Portuguese parliamentary left.
Spain, like Portugal, is a democratic state of law, where freedom of the press has protection.
It is therefore up to those who say they are affected by any conduct contrary to that right to act with the competent bodies.

The proponents of this vote are responsible for the reflection and weighting necessary to ensure that they are not lost in a state of responsibility that the parties on the right of parliament lose the north, clinging to anything that can serve as a weapon of fire.
For all this, I voted against vote No 244/XIII (2a).
PS deputy Isabel Santos.
Members' presences and shortcomings at the plenary meeting.
THE REDATION DIVISION AND AUDIOVISUAL SUPPORT.
